title: Getting 14 days ban for playing champ 1st time (NO JOKE)
body:
That's the situation. I had previous 2 toxic games - I agree with RIOT decision but the 3rd one where i got banned just because I pick Ivern for the 1st time ? 
I got reported by my team who viewed my decision as troll and RIOT agrees?
1) I didn't troll (actually I never troll, RIOT can look into my history)
2) I am the only player who actually got a kill 
3) i didn't feed (those who reported me had 0/0 0/5 0/6 0/9 , mean while i had 1/3). 

Let me explain the reason why I pick Ivern. From my experience I literally haven't won a single game with Nunu in the team, so my decision in this game was to pick a new champ and try it out - how is it punishable ? And you know what - just as I KNEW, Nunu didn't contribute anything at all for the team, instead he end up with 0/9 stats. Essential, my team end up refusing to cooperate with me, trolled me and trolled RIOT to ban me.

replies.body: What about the other games that were provided in your reform card?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EAcuEHeo,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-06-02T19:31:44.144+0000)
>
> What about the other games that were provided in your reform card?

I absolutely agree about RIOT decision regarding other games, but we are talking the last game which made this ban to happen.
All games provided to you via the card are example games that contributed to the ban, you can't just ignore other games and claim that only one of the games is what caused your ban.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EAcuEHeo,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2017-06-02T19:43:23.481+0000)

If so, why the 3rd game was fatal  considering 3rd game was a fake accusation against me ?

> [{quoted}](name=saltisLT,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EAcuEHeo,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-02T20:01:51.499+0000)
>
> If so, why the 3rd game was fatal  considering 3rd game was a fake accusation against me ?

Because you had accumulated enough reports that another one made the system re-check your account's history. In effect it may have been an unjustified report, but it triggered a review of previous behavior that justified a ban.

The system doesn't really work on a "X strikes" system -- it works whenever it identifies toxic behavior. So even if the report was false it may have uncovered toxic behavior, and is thus working as intended.

Happy to help. :)

> ps. down-voting a thread for trying to defend against fake report doesn't really gives more respect.

I'm probably not the person you want to address this to -- I actually reserve downvotes specifically for threads where the initial poster is clearly not interested in anything but ranting about how unfair the rules are. :)

I believe the reason you're getting them here, however, is that it is possible to interpret the fact that you didn't acknowledge or mention the other games on your reform card and the contents of their logs -- we get a lot of people hiding parts of their logs in an attempt to pretend to be innocent and, even though that may not have been your intent, I suspect a lot of people are reading it that way.

> [{quoted}](name=saltisLT,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EAcuEHeo,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-06-02T19:33:38.056+0000)
>
> I absolutely agree about RIOT decision regarding other games, but we are talking the last game which made this ban to happen.

There is always a chance that the report that pushes you over the edge isn't necessarily the most justified report, but you still had to accumulate a TON of reports to your number of games played to make the system take notice, or have very egregious behavior. Those other games mattered more, and in this case the system just may have caught you one game sooner than it would have otherwise. There's not some "special number" of toxic games you get -- it's just how long it takes the system to confirm your behavior.

So the ban isn't for playing a champ for the 1st time -- it's for accumulating a percentage of valid games reported that you were RIGHT on the tipping point of a ban, and then that last report making the system recheck your account's standing. You were banned entirely for your other behavior.

Was it this game or the other game before this that triggered the ban? Were the other two chats similar offenses or verbal abuse? Do the other two game chats indicate that he tilted and for his third game decided to troll his team? Those are my questions for him.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us

Is this a normals or ranked match? Personally for normals I would not have reported you because the match is there to experiment and learn new things. For ranked I would have considered it you trying to troll the team. Co op vs ai is great for first clear jungling but after that it's useless for experience in actual gameplay.

"Let me explain the reason why I pick Ivern. From my experience I literally haven't won a single game with Nunu in the team, so my decision in this game was to pick a new champ and try it out - how is it punishable ? And you know what - just as I KNEW, Nunu didn't contribute anything at all for the team, instead he end up with 0/9 stats. Essential, my team end up refusing to cooperate with me, trolled me and trolled RIOT to ban me."

This section does not help your cause. You honestly should have left that out if you wanted your ban lifted; now you may have to live with it.

I agree with what you say, but I am not aware there are rules you can't play champion for the 1st time if you are in ranked. 
In fact I support the idea that ranked champs should be at least lvl 5 otherwise it creates huge discrepancy between who plays 1st time vs lvl 7 champ.

There're no rules regarding first timing champs in ranked. None at all. But the explanation you provided indicates that you first timed something because you wanted to sacrifice the possibility of a win. No one knows you're first timing a champ but you indicated this in chat for no other feasible reason than to get back at nunu. You indicated that you WANTED to lose. First timing urgot adc because you got filled adc and don't own anything ranged other than urgot is different that picking ivern adc and saying first time ivern guys lol in chat.

 I didn't say anything negative to them, not a single word for their picks, even I didn't like it. Yet, they didn't like my pick and they initiated ban.

It's not that you picked a champ for the first time, it's that you did it because you thought the match was already lost and knew that picking Ivern was unlikely to help your team win (in fact, it sounds like you knew picking the champ for the first time would help the team lose). But you did it anyway.

It sounds like you threw the match before it began under the guise of "practicing" a champ.

Nunu win rate in the jungle is statistically 55% (he actually has the top win% among junglers in your region right now), your personal experiences do not dictate if something will work or not.
